meanings.definition: Probably: used to indicate the likelihood of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: She will prob arrive late to the party.
meanings.sent3: He is so slow, he will prob get there after everyone leaves.
meanings.sent4: The chances of winning the lottery are as slim as her prob showing up on time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's prediction was spot on, as she prob knew the outcome in advance.

meanings.definition: Probability: the likelihood of something happening or being true.
meanings.sent1: The prob of winning the game is low.
meanings.sent2: There is a high prob of success with this plan.
meanings.sent3: The prob of finding a four-leaf clover is like searching for a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: The prob of encountering a unicorn is as likely as winning the lottery.
meanings.sent5: The prob of passing the test increased after studying diligently.

meanings.definition: Probable: likely to happen or be true.
meanings.sent1: It is prob that she will attend the event.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds make it prob that it will rain soon.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was so ridiculous, it was prob the dog ate his homework.
meanings.sent4: The prob outcome of the experiment was exactly as predicted.
meanings.sent5: The detective found the most prob suspect based on the evidence.
